name: Where in the Bible Am I? Quiz | The Bible | 10 Questions

questions.text: Where would you find the verse, "In the beginning God created the heaven and the earth"?
questions.explanation:
Genesis 1:1.

	The book of Genesis is the first book of the Bible. Chapter 1 tells about how the world was created from nothing.

questions.text: Where would you find the verse, "Have not I commanded thee? Be strong and of a good courage; be not afraid, neither be thou dismayed: for the LORD thy God is with thee whithersoever thou goest."?
questions.explanation:
Joshua 1:9.

	Joshua is the sixth book of the King James Bible. The book of Joshua was written by Joshua, son of Nun.

questions.text: Where would you find the verse, "And Ruth said, Intreat me not to leave thee, or to return from following after thee: for whither thou goest, I will go; and where thou lodgest, I will lodge: thy people shall be my people, and thy God my God."?
questions.explanation:
Ruth 1:16.

	Ruth is the eighth book of the King James Bible. Ruth's author is unknown. Ruth is one of the shortest books in the Bible with only four chapters.

questions.text: Where would you find the verse, "And said, Naked came I out of my mother's womb, and naked shall I return thither: the LORD gave, and the LORD hath taken away; blessed be the name of the LORD."?
questions.explanation:
Job 1:21.

	Job was known for his patience. His book is the 18th book of the King James Bible. Job is considered a book of poetry.

questions.text: Where would you find the verse, "The Lord is my shepherd I shall not want."?
questions.explanation:
Psalm 23:1.

	Psalms is the 19th book of the King James Bible. Psalms is the longest book of the Bible with 150 chapters. The longest chapter in Psalms is Psalm 119.

questions.text: Where would you find the verse that says, "And we know that all things work together for good to them that love God, to them who are the called according to his purpose."?
questions.explanation:
Romans 8:28.

	A lot of people misunderstand this verse. Many people think the verse is saying everything will be good. But this is not the case. What it says is God takes the good and the bad and uses it for the good in the long run.

questions.text: Where would you find the verse that says, "I can do all things through Christ which strengtheneth me."?
questions.explanation:
Philippians 4:13.

	Christians believe the key part to this verse is "through Christ". Philippians can be found in the New Testament following Ephesians. One way to remember the order of the books Galatians, Ephesians, Philippians and Colossians is the sentence: Gentiles Eat Pork Chops.

questions.text: Where would you find the verse that says, "Go ye therefore, and teach all nations, baptizing them in the name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Ghost."?
questions.explanation:
Matthew 28:19.

	Matthew is the first book of the New Testament. It was written by Matthew who was the tax collector. He is also known by the name Levi.

questions.text: Where is the verse that says, "I am crucified with Christ: nevertheless I live; yet not I, but Christ liveth in me: and the life which I now live in the flesh I live by the faith of the Son of God, who loved me, and gave himself for me."?
questions.explanation:
Galatians 2:20.

	Galatians is one of the letters written by Paul. This verse talks about one's sinful nature dying when they accept Christ as Savior. This does not mean however that they will no longer sin. Christians believe that everyone sins, since the only perfect person is Jesus.

questions.text: Where would you find the verse, "If we confess our sins, he is faithful and just to forgive us our sins, and to cleanse us from all unrighteousness."?
questions.explanation:
I John 1:9.

	The three books of John are some of the shortest books in the Bible. They were written by John who also, according to tradition, wrote Revelation.
